subject: Investing
title: Bond Prices and Interest Rates
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Bond Prices and Interest Rates.

hook.text: You hold a bond paying 3%. The Fed raises rates to 5%. Nobody wants your 3% bond anymore. Its price drops.

buildup.text: Bond prices and interest rates move in opposite directions. This is the most important rule in fixed income.

discovery.text: When rates rise, existing bonds with lower coupons become less attractive. Their prices fall to match new yields.

twist.text: Long-term bonds move more than short-term ones. A 30-year bond can lose 20% from a 1% rate hike.

climax.text: In 2022, the Fed raised rates aggressively. Long-term Treasury bonds lost over 30% â€” their worst year ever.

punchline.text: Rising rates punish existing bonds. Falling rates reward them.

quiz.question: What happens to existing bond prices when interest rates rise?
